subject: Real Estate
title: Eminent Domain: When Government Takes Your Home
description: A quick win: understand Eminent Domain: When Government Takes Your Home.

hook.text: In 2005, the U.S. Supreme Court ruled a city could take private homes and give the land to a developer.

buildup.text: Eminent domain lets governments seize private property for 'public use' â€” roads, schools, or utilities.

discovery.text: The Fifth Amendment requires 'just compensation,' but owners often argue the payment is far below market value.

twist.text: In Kelo v. New London, 'public use' was expanded to include private development that generates tax revenue.

climax.text: The ruling sparked outrage. Over 40 states passed laws restricting eminent domain in response.
